title: Variant Consequence
description: Consequence of a Variant - particularly in terms of consequence to transcript

var_conseq_name.title: Sequence Ontology Style Name of the Variant Consequence

var_conseq_id.title: Variant Consequence Identifier
var_conseq_id.description: SO term ID for the variant consequence eg. SO:0001893

url.title: URL
url.description: A URL to the site with more information about the consequence term - MISO.

severity_order_estimate.title: Severity Rank
severity_order_estimate.description: Ensembl ranking of estimate of consequence severity with lower numbers being more severe

impact.title: IMPACT
impact.description: The IMPACT rating expresses a subjective call on the likely impact of the variant (see snpEff). MODIFIER - usually non-coding variants or variants affecting non-coding genes, where predictions are difficult or there is no evidence of impact. LOW - a variant that is assumed to be mostly harmless or unlikely to change protein behaviour. MODERATE - a non-disruptive variant that might change protein effectiveness. HIGH - the variant is assumed to have high (disruptive) impact in the protein, probably causing protein truncation, loss of function or triggering nonsense mediated decay.

location.title: Location
location.description: The location within the gene/transcript upon which the variant has its consequence

coding_effect.title: Coding Effect
coding_effect.description: Effect of variant that resides within the coding sequence
